title: Kronecker's Jugendtraum (Hilbert's 12th)
description: Hilbert's 12th Problem asks to extend the Kronecker-Weber theorem: find explicit generators for all abelian extensions of number fields.

overview.historicalContext: Kronecker's 'youthful dream' (Jugendtraum) was to find explicit generators for abelian extensions. For Q, the answer is cyclotomic fields (Kronecker-Weber). For imaginary quadratic fields, complex multiplication provides the answer.
overview.problemStatement:
**Problem:** Given a number field K, find explicit analytic functions whose special values generate all abelian extensions of K.

**Status:** Solved for Q and imaginary quadratic fields; open in general.
overview.proofStrategy:
The file proves:
1. Cyclotomic extensions of Q are abelian
2. Statement of Kronecker-Weber theorem
3. Connection to class field theory
keyInsights: For Q: abelian extensions are cyclotomic
For imaginary quadratic: complex multiplication answers

sections.title: Kronecker-Weber Theorem
sections.summary: Abelian extensions of Q are contained in cyclotomic fields.

conclusion.summary: Hilbert's 12th Problem is solved for Q and imaginary quadratic fields. The general case remains open and connects to the Langlands program.
conclusion.implications: This problem initiated class field theory and connects to modern number theory including Stark conjectures and Langlands program.
openQuestions: What are explicit generators for real quadratic fields?
How does this connect to the Langlands program?
What is the role of modular forms?
